update.description:
* First iteration of gsoc plugins project. Attached plugins of models displayed in world tab.

* Created subtree with filename, innerxml, updated comments, added plugin to test and ModelToSDF() function.

* reverted msgs to standard PluginToSDF() function.

* updated changelog.

* changed innerxml test.

* first draft with plugin type error message.

* fill pluginMsg implemented. Response not receiving data.

* Add Property Box for Plugins. Change info to model_plugin

* Removed qDebug() code lines.

* update comments

* corrected Qt::Flags warning and integrated feedback from louise. std::mutex receiveMutex on my system not able to compile, pls check.

* fix build, add some doxygen, cleanup some spaces, simplify Model::OnRequest

* fix test

* Close branch attach_plugins_louise

* test for model plugins. still fails.

* added URI to test uniqueness of model plugins. Test still fails.

* tweaks to test and URI usage

* Close branch attach_plugins_louise

* sensor msg can not be serialized it seems.

* implemented sensor properties + uniqueness with uris. Added test, fails.
update.title: Display sensors of links in world tab + display properties

pullrequest.title: Display sensors of links in world tab + display properties

content.raw:
I took a look at this and there seems to be a problem loading `camera.world` within a QTest. I ticketed issue #1996.

Could you change the test to use `imu_demo.world` instead please? That world has a sensor and I verified that it doesn't crash the test. Thanks!
content.html:
I took a look at this and there seems to be a problem loading camera.world within a QTest. I ticketed issue #1996.

Could you change the test to use imu_demo.world instead please? That world has a sensor and I verified that it doesn't crash the test. Thanks!

content.raw:
@almin , it is a good idea to do a code check before submitting your pull requests. From gazebo's root folder, just run `sh tools/code_check.sh`. I'm seeing the following warnings for this branch, could you fix them please?

~~~
./gazebo/physics/Link.cc:435:  Blank line at the start of a code block.  Is this needed?  [whitespace/blank_line] [2]
./gazebo/physics/Link.cc:439:  Blank line at the start of a code block.  Is this needed?  [whitespace/blank_line] [2]
./gazebo/physics/Link.cc:451:  Line ends in whitespace.  Consider deleting these extra spaces.  [whitespace/end_of_line] [4]
./gazebo/physics/Link.cc:457:  Line ends in whitespace.  Consider deleting these extra spaces.  [whitespace/end_of_line] [4]
./gazebo/physics/Link.hh:772:  Could not find a newline character at the end of the file.  [whitespace/ending_newline] [5]
./gazebo/gui/ModelListWidget_TEST.hh:80:  Line ends in whitespace.  Consider deleting these extra spaces.  [whitespace/end_of_line] [4]
./gazebo/gui/ModelListWidget_TEST.hh:86:  Lines should be <= 80 characters long  [whitespace/line_length] [2]
./gazebo/gui/ModelListWidget_TEST.cc:1420:  Could not find a newline character at the end of the file.  [whitespace/ending_newline] [5]
./gazebo/gui/ModelListWidget.cc:241:  Blank line at the start of a code block.  Is this needed?  [whitespace/blank_line] [2]
./gazebo/gui/ModelListWidget.cc:258:  Missing space before ( in if(  [whitespace/parens] [5]
./gazebo/gui/ModelListWidget.cc:303:  Line ends in whitespace.  Consider deleting these extra spaces.  [whitespace/end_of_line] [4]
./gazebo/gui/ModelListWidget.cc:427:  Line ends in whitespace.  Consider deleting these extra spaces.  [whitespace/end_of_line] [4]
./gazebo/gui/ModelListWidget.cc:445:  Blank line at the start of a code block.  Is this needed?  [whitespace/blank_line] [2]
./gazebo/gui/ModelListWidget.cc:465:  Lines should be <= 80 characters long  [whitespace/line_length] [2]
./gazebo/gui/ModelListWidget.cc:2261:  Line ends in whitespace.  Consider deleting these extra spaces.  [whitespace/end_of_line] [4]
./gazebo/gui/ModelListWidget.cc:2301:  Line ends in whitespace.  Consider deleting these extra spaces.  [whitespace/end_of_line] [4]
./gazebo/gui/ModelListWidget.cc:3678:  Could not find a newline character at the end of the file.  [whitespace/ending_newline] [5]
~~~
content.html:
@almin , it is a good idea to do a code check before submitting your pull requests. From gazebo's root folder, just run sh tools/code_check.sh. I'm seeing the following warnings for this branch, could you fix them please?

./gazebo/physics/Link.cc:435:  Blank line at the start of a code block.  Is this needed?  [whitespace/blank_line] [2]
./gazebo/physics/Link.cc:439:  Blank line at the start of a code block.  Is this needed?  [whitespace/blank_line] [2]
./gazebo/physics/Link.cc:451:  Line ends in whitespace.  Consider deleting these extra spaces.  [whitespace/end_of_line] [4]
./gazebo/physics/Link.cc:457:  Line ends in whitespace.  Consider deleting these extra spaces.  [whitespace/end_of_line] [4]
./gazebo/physics/Link.hh:772:  Could not find a newline character at the end of the file.  [whitespace/ending_newline] [5]
./gazebo/gui/ModelListWidget_TEST.hh:80:  Line ends in whitespace.  Consider deleting these extra spaces.  [whitespace/end_of_line] [4]
./gazebo/gui/ModelListWidget_TEST.hh:86:  Lines should be <= 80 characters long  [whitespace/line_length] [2]
./gazebo/gui/ModelListWidget_TEST.cc:1420:  Could not find a newline character at the end of the file.  [whitespace/ending_newline] [5]
./gazebo/gui/ModelListWidget.cc:241:  Blank line at the start of a code block.  Is this needed?  [whitespace/blank_line] [2]
./gazebo/gui/ModelListWidget.cc:258:  Missing space before ( in if(  [whitespace/parens] [5]
./gazebo/gui/ModelListWidget.cc:303:  Line ends in whitespace.  Consider deleting these extra spaces.  [whitespace/end_of_line] [4]
./gazebo/gui/ModelListWidget.cc:427:  Line ends in whitespace.  Consider deleting these extra spaces.  [whitespace/end_of_line] [4]
./gazebo/gui/ModelListWidget.cc:445:  Blank line at the start of a code block.  Is this needed?  [whitespace/blank_line] [2]
./gazebo/gui/ModelListWidget.cc:465:  Lines should be <= 80 characters long  [whitespace/line_length] [2]

pull_request.title: Display sensors of links in world tab + display properties

pullrequest.title: Display sensors of links in world tab + display properties

content.raw:
So if I understand correctly, this is checking one level deeper for an item which matches `selectedEntityName`, correct? This looks very similar to the functionality provided by `ModelListWidget::ListItem`, used above. We can leave it like this for now, but it might be interesting to reimplement `ListItem` in a recursive way so that it can check an indefinite depth. This will be especially helpful to start displaying nested models in the panel correctly.

I imagine it will look very similar to what we do in the model editor with [ModelTreeWidget::FindItemByData](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/4004fbd7deede758c0ca0fbc7c906e62b0a808a4/gazebo/gui/model/ModelTreeWidget.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#ModelTreeWidget.cc-632)
content.html:
So if I understand correctly, this is checking one level deeper for an item which matches selectedEntityName, correct? This looks very similar to the functionality provided by ModelListWidget::ListItem, used above. We can leave it like this for now, but it might be interesting to reimplement ListItem in a recursive way so that it can check an indefinite depth. This will be especially helpful to start displaying nested models in the panel correctly.

I imagine it will look very similar to what we do in the model editor with ModelTreeWidget::FindItemByData
